alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 10:56AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River Above Carlin affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Upper Humboldt...including Elko, Carlin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Humboldt River Above Carlin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:10 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:25 AM PDT Saturday was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 1200 PM PDT.
